title: Air resistance - acceleration of falling object

content.question: An object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> falling near Earth’s surface experiences a resistive force of <math alttext="F sub R, equals negative b times v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> is a positive constant with units of <math alttext="Newton seconds squared per square meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>N</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>s</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup><mo>/</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> is in <math alttext="meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>. What is the magnitude of the acceleration of the object when it is moving downward at a speed <math alttext="v equals the square root of the fraction 3 m g, over 4 b, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>b</mi></mrow></mfrac></msqrt></math>?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
